Context:
The Advanced French Patisserie postgraduate program is offered in partnership with École Nationale Supérieure de Pâtisserie (ENSP), a renowned pastry chef school in France. Students will have opportunities to study in some of the best patisseries, bakeries, restaurants, and hotels in France. After their experiences in France, students will demonstrate their skills through events, placements, and showcasing their newly acquired skills back at George Brown College. The program schedule operates from Monday to Friday.

Students have the option for an externship in France through ENSP and are encouraged to pursue self-directed industry work experience opportunities. George Brown also provides learning opportunities with real-world challenges and clients.

Career options for graduates of this program include various opportunities in Toronto and around the world, as a knowledge of French patisserie techniques is highly valued. The required courses for the first semester include HOSF 4021 - Advanced French Pastry – Theory & Practical (Part 1), HOSF 4025 - French Language, HOSF 4027 - Gastronomy, and HOSF 4031 - Advanced French Pastry II (in France).
file_path: scraped_pages/programpages2023/Advanced French Patisserie Program (Postgraduate) H413 | George Brown College2023.txt

Context:
Program Offered:
- HOSF 4031: Advanced French Pastry II (*IN FRANCE) (SEMESTER 2)
- HOSF 4032: Externship (*IN FRANCE)
- HOSF 4021: Advanced French Pastry II (*Part 2) (SEMESTER 3)
- HOSF 4042: Patisserie Capstone
- HOSF 1170: The Slow Food Experience

Courses Names:
- HOSF 4031, HOSF 4032, HOSF 4021, HOSF 4042, HOSF 1170

Semesters:
- SEMESTER 2, SEMESTER 3

Program Learning Outcomes:
1. Apply techniques such as reconstituting, revising, laminating and assembling to traditional French pastry and baking, using emerging trends in the French patisserie.
2. Converse in basic French and use correct terminology within a food service operation.
3. Identify the holistic practices in French gastronomy through field education and/or gastronomic theory.
4. Prepare French pastries and baked goods within Canadian and EU health, safety and nutrition regulations, standards, guidelines and processes.
5. Develop unique baking, pastry or confectionery product and manage the commercialization and marketing of that product.
6. Manage the production, sales and business aspects of a personally created line of French pastries and baked goods.

Tuition & Fees:
- Domestic Tuition: $15,046.00 (for three semesters starting Fall 2022)
- International Tuition: $34,381.00 (estimated for three semesters starting Spring 2024)

Additional Costs:
- Uniform: $290
- Black safety shoes: $110 - $160
- Knives and small wares: $500–$700
- Airfare: Not specified in the text.
file_path: scraped_pages/programpages2023/Advanced French Patisserie Program (Postgraduate) H413 | George Brown College2023.txt

Context:
Program Fees and Financial Assistance:
- Knives and small wares: $110 - $160
- Airfare to France (approximate): $500–$700 (excluding transfer costs and applicable taxes)
- International Students: Visit International Fees and Related Costs page for more information.
- Financial Assistance: Approved for OSAP funding for applicants who meet OSAP eligibility criteria.

Admission Requirements:
- Diploma or bachelor's degree in Baking, Pastry Arts, or Culinary Management OR a one-year certificate in Baking, Pastry Arts, Patisserie Apprenticeship AND a minimum one-year of relevant work experience (resumé and references required) OR a diploma or bachelor's degree in an unrelated field AND a minimum of one-year full-time relevant work experience (resumé and references required).
- English Language Proficiency: Applicants with international transcripts who do not provide English language proficiency test results must test at the college level in the George Brown College English assessment to be considered for admission. Visit English Proficiency page for more details.
- International Students: Visit International Admissions page for more information regarding country-specific admission requirements.

Special Requirements:
- Valid WHMIS and Sanitation certification prior to the start of the program.
- Health Policy: Students should be aware that various allergens, including nuts, dairy, and shellfish are routinely used in practical labs. George Brown College is sensitive to religious observances but may not meet specific dietary laws related to halal and kosher foods.

Application Process:
- Domestic students should apply through Ontario Colleges.
- International Students should apply through the George Brown College Online Application System. Visit How to Apply page for more information on how and when to apply.
